title: How to Reserve a Spot for an Event
content:
If a user asks how to reserve an event:

- Guide them to the CultPass app
- Instruct them to browse the experience catalog and tap 'Reserve'
- If it's a premium or limited event, check if reservation confirmation is required (in-app or email)
- Remind them to arrive at least 15 minutes early with their QR code visible

Notes for the agent:
- If the user can’t find the event, ask for city/date/category and suggest using Search/Filters
- If the event is full, suggest waitlist (if available) or alternative dates/events

Suggested phrasing:
"You can reserve an experience by opening the CultPass app, selecting your desired event, and tapping 'Reserve'. Please arrive 15 minutes early with your QR code ready."

title: What's Included in a CultPass Subscription
content:
Each user is entitled to 4 cultural experiences per month, which may include:
- Art exhibitions
- Museum entries
- Music concerts
- Film screenings
- Workshops or guided tours (when available)

Premium experiences:
- Some experiences may require an additional fee (shown in the app before confirming)
- Availability can be limited; reservation may be required

Suggested phrasing:
"Your CultPass subscription includes 4 curated experiences each month. You can choose from museums, concerts, film events and more. Premium events may have an extra cost, which is shown during reservation."

title: How to Cancel or Pause a Subscription
content:
Users can manage their plan via the app: My Account > Manage Plan.

- Cancel: Takes effect at the end of the current billing cycle
- Pause: Temporarily stops future billing; user data and history remain
- Do NOT promise refunds; only a support lead can approve exceptions

Agent checks:
- If the user is canceling due to a technical issue, offer troubleshooting or escalate if needed
- Confirm whether they want cancel (end-of-cycle) vs pause (temporary)

Suggested phrasing:
"You can cancel or pause your subscription anytime via My Account > Manage Plan in the CultPass app. Cancellation takes effect at the end of your current billing cycle."

title: How to Handle Login Issues
content:
Most login issues are resolved with a password reset.

Steps:
- Ask the user to tap 'Forgot Password' on the login screen
- Confirm they are using the correct registered email
- If they did not receive the reset email: check spam/junk, verify email spelling, and retry after 10 minutes

Escalate to human support if:
- The user no longer has access to their email
- Reset emails never arrive after multiple attempts
- The account appears locked or compromised

Suggested phrasing:
"Please tap 'Forgot Password' on the login screen and make sure you're using the email linked to your account. If the email doesn’t arrive, check spam or try again in a few minutes."

title: How to Find and Use Your QR Code at Check-In
content:
If a user asks how entry/check-in works:

- Explain that most venues validate entry using a QR code in the reservation
- Instruct them to open the CultPass app > My Reservations (or Tickets) > select the event to display the QR code
- Remind them to increase screen brightness and have the QR code ready before reaching the entrance

Common issues:
- QR code not showing: ask them to refresh, log out/in, or update the app
- Venue can’t scan: suggest increasing brightness, cleaning screen, or using a screenshot (if allowed)

Suggested phrasing:
"Open the CultPass app, go to My Reservations, and tap your event to display the QR code. Please have it ready at the entrance—turning up brightness helps scanning."

title: What to Do If an Event Is Full or Sold Out
content:
If a user cannot reserve because the event is full:

- Confirm the event date/time and their city
- Check whether a waitlist option is available (in-app)
- Suggest alternatives: different time slots, different dates, or similar experiences

Escalation guidance:
- Do not override capacity limits
- Escalate only if the user claims they were charged or received a confirmation but the app shows 'Full'

Suggested phrasing:
"If the event is full, please check whether a waitlist is available in the app. If not, I can help you find a similar experience or another date/time."

title: How Premium Events and Extra Fees Work
content:
Premium experiences may require an additional payment.

Agent rules:
- Always point users to the price shown in the app before they confirm
- Explain what the fee covers when it’s stated (e.g., special access, limited seating)
- Never quote a fee unless you see it in the user’s screenshot/details

If a user disputes a premium fee:
- Ask for the event name/date and a screenshot of the checkout screen
- Escalate to billing support if they believe they were charged incorrectly

Suggested phrasing:
"Some premium experiences have an extra fee, which you’ll see clearly before confirming the reservation. If you think a charge looks wrong, share the event name/date and a screenshot and we’ll investigate."

title: Monthly Experience Limits and Reset Timing
content:
CultPass includes 4 experiences per month.

How it works:
- Each successful reservation that is redeemed/used counts toward the monthly limit (unless the app explicitly states otherwise)
- The monthly allowance resets each billing month (based on the user’s subscription renewal date)

If a user says they 'lost' experiences:
- Ask for their renewal date and whether they made reservations they didn’t attend
- Check for used/redeemed status vs canceled reservations
- Escalate if the app count appears incorrect after refresh and re-login

Suggested phrasing:
"Your plan includes 4 experiences per billing month, and it resets on your renewal date. If your count looks off, tell me your renewal date and which reservations you’ve made this month."

title: How to Change Reservation Details (Time/Date)
content:
If a user wants to change a reservation:

- Explain that most reservations can’t be edited directly; users typically need to cancel and rebook (if slots are available)
- Direct them to My Reservations > select event > Cancel (if allowed) > then reserve the new time

Important:
- If the event is limited/premium, warn them that rebooking is subject to availability
- If cancellation is disabled close to the start time, advise contacting support

Suggested phrasing:
"Reservations usually can’t be edited. The quickest option is to cancel the existing booking (if allowed) and reserve the new time slot. I can help you locate the nearest available time."

title: When and How to Escalate to Human Support
content:
Escalate to human support when:
- The user reports incorrect charges, duplicate charges, or missing refunds that were approved
- The user cannot access their account and password reset fails
- QR code/reservation is missing but the user has a confirmation email or receipt
- Safety issues at a venue or serious customer complaints

Before escalating, collect:
- Registered email
- Event name/date/time (if relevant)
- Screenshots of the issue (error message, checkout screen, confirmation email)
- Device type and app version (if technical)

Suggested phrasing:
"I can’t fully resolve this from here, but I can escalate it to our support team. Please share your account email, the event details, and a screenshot of what you’re seeing."

title: How to Update Your Payment Method
content:
If a user wants to add or change their payment method:

Steps:
- Direct them to My Account > Payment Methods in the CultPass app
- They can add a new credit/debit card or update an existing one
- Supported payment methods: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, PayPal (if available)
- Once saved, they can select it as the default for future billing

Agent guidelines:
- Do NOT ask users to share card details; they must enter them directly in the secure app
- If payment fails during a reservation, ask them to verify:
  - Card is not expired
  - Billing address matches their card issuer's records
  - They have not exceeded daily purchase limits with their bank
- If a card is declined repeatedly, suggest contacting their bank or using an alternate payment method

Suggested phrasing:
"You can add or change your payment method by going to My Account > Payment Methods in the app. All card information is securely encrypted. If your card is being declined, check with your bank to ensure it's active and not blocked."

title: CultPass Refund Policy and How to Request a Refund
content:
Subscription refunds:
- Monthly subscription: No refund for the current billing month; only future charges can be stopped via cancellation
- Refunds for cancellations are NOT automatic; they require escalation to support

Refund exceptions are approved only for:
- Duplicate charges (e.g., accidentally charged twice in one day)
- Unauthorized charges
- Technical error by CultPass that prevented access/usage

Agent instructions:
- Do NOT promise refunds; only support leads can approve
- If a user requests a refund, ask:
  - When they were charged (screenshot of receipt or confirmation email)
  - Why they believe the charge is unjustified
  - Whether they've already canceled or paused their plan
- Collect these details and escalate to billing@cultpass.support

Suggested phrasing:
"Refunds for subscription charges require review by our billing team. If you believe you were charged incorrectly or twice, I can escalate this. Please share the date of the charge, a receipt screenshot, and briefly explain the issue."

title: How to Report a Technical Bug or App Issue
content:
If a user experiences a bug that is NOT a login problem:

Troubleshooting steps:
1. Ask them to restart the app (close completely and reopen)
2. If still broken, ask them to update to the latest app version
3. If the issue persists, ask them to log out and log back in
4. Last resort: uninstall and reinstall the app (warn them data may be lost)

If none of these works, escalate with:
- Device type (iOS/Android) and device model
- App version number (visible in settings)
- Screenshot of the error or the persistent bug
- Steps to reproduce the bug

Common bugs to look for:
- Reservation not showing in 'My Reservations' but user has confirmation email → escalate
- QR code won't load → app refresh usually fixes
- Events not appearing in search → try clearing filters or updating the app
- App crashes on startup → suggest reinstall

Suggested phrasing:
"Let's troubleshoot! First, please completely close the CultPass app and reopen it. If that doesn't work, check if there's an app update available. If the issue persists, tell me what device you're using, the app version, and a screenshot of what you're seeing."

title: Get Personalized Experience Recommendations
content:
If a user asks what to experience or attend:

Agent role:
- Help them narrow down their interests
- Suggest experiences based on availability and preferences
- Remind them of their monthly quota (4 experiences/month)

Gathering information:
- Ask: "What interests you most—art, music, film, theater, or outdoor activities?"
- Ask for their location or preferred city
- Ask: "Are you looking for something this weekend, or further out?"
- Check: "Do you have any experiences left in your monthly quota?"

How to search:
- Instruct them to open CultPass app > Browse or Search
- Recommend using Category/Date/Location filters
- If they want trending events: look for 'Featured' or 'Popular This Week'
- Premium events may have extra fees; remind them these count toward their quota only when redeemed

Agent suggestions:
- "Based on your interest in art, I'd recommend checking the Contemporary Art Exhibition this Saturday or the Modern Sculpture Workshop next week. Both have open slots."
- "You have 2 experiences left this month. I'd suggest booking soon since popular events fill up fast."

Suggested phrasing:
"I'd love to help you find something great! Tell me what interests you—art, music, theater—and where you're located. I can point you toward available experiences that match your taste. You also have [X] experiences left in your monthly quota."

title: Invoice, Payment History, and Billing Questions
content:
If a user has billing or invoice questions:

How to access billing info:
- Instruct them to go to My Account > Billing in the CultPass app
- They can view:
  - Current subscription price
  - Billing cycle dates
  - Payment history and receipts
  - Upcoming charges

Common questions:
- "Why was I charged $XX on [date]?" → Check their billing cycle start date; they're charged on the same day each month
- "Can I get an invoice for my company?" → Suggest downloading/screenshotting the receipt from the app; if they need an official invoice, escalate
- "I don't recognize a charge" → Escalate to billing; collect order number, date, and amount

Agent notes:
- Subscription is billed monthly on the same day each month
- Premium/extra fees appear on the same invoice as the monthly subscription
- One-off experience fees are included in the monthly billing statement
- Users can download PDFs of their receipts/invoices from the app

Suggested phrasing:
"You can view your complete billing history and download receipts by going to My Account > Billing in the CultPass app. Your subscription is billed on the same date each month. If you see a charge you don't recognize, I can help investigate or escalate to our billing team for further review."
